Sherry Yuxuan Chen

I am a fourth year Engineering Science student at the University of Toronto, majoring in Robotics Engineering and minoring in Artificial Intelligence.

I am a undergraduate researcher at Robotics, Vision and Learning Lab supervised by Prof. Florian Shkurti. I am passionate about Computer Vision and Deep Learning. My current research focus is unsupervised/self-supervised video represention learning and pseudo label generation.

I am actively looking for full time position in software, robotics, and machine learning. Please see my resume for my past experience and feel free to reach out to me via email.

Research

I'm interested in computer vision, unsupervised learning, and video representation learning. My final year thesis topic is on self-supervised video representation learning via pseudo-label generation.

Self-supervised Video Similarity Search via Pseudo Label Generation

The goal of the research project is to build a self-supervised video representation learning framework which learns embeddings that group semantically similar videos together while pushing dissimilar ones apart.

We propose a simplistic pseudo label generation stage via clustering prior to the training. The obtained pseudo labels can guide the negatives sampling process during contrastive learning and further close the gap between self-supervised and supervised learning.

You can view the thesis proposal here.

View the mid-term progress presentation presentation slides here.
Work Experience
Teaching Assistant

2020 August - present

I am currently TAing for ROB301, which is a 3rd year Engineering Science robotics course. I helped building similation worlds in Gazebo and enabled viewing the simulation via browsers in GzWeb, which allow students to work from home and complete the labs remotely. Other main responsibilities include developing sample code and lab handouts, as well as overseeing synchronous lab sessions.

Lab Assistant

2018 August - 2018 October

I was a undergraduate lab assistant of ROB301 during the summer of 2018. I helped design 4 robotics labs and the final project on Turtlebot3. I Developed the starter software packages on ROS to interface with various sensors such as IMU, Lidar, and Camera. Developed and tested the sample code for robotics algorithms such as PID control, Extended Kalman Filter, and Bayesian Localization. You can view the demo video on bayesiain localization implemented on TurtleBot3.


Software Engineer Intern

2019 May - 2020 May

During my one-year internship (PEY) at Intel, I participated in the development of a data-driven application in Python for correlating software simulation results and silicon testing data for FPGA timing/power analysis. I re-designed the data pipeline to compile, simulate, analyze, and visualize over 1,000 design patterns daily with the goal of high parallelism and high efficiency, which reduced the total runtime by 40%. I also independently re-architected a PostgreSQL database with 1TB of data and over 100 tables for scalability, after applying various database techniques to improve the runtime efficiency, which sped up the query performance by 20%.



Software Engineer Co-op

2018 May - 2018 Sept

I interned at Thales for four months after second year. I was responsible for implementing code changes to the On-board Controller software in the Singapore digital railway signaling system. I also designed various testing scenarios to validate code changes in order to optimize the functionality of Automatic Train Protection software.


AuToronto Perception Team Member (Lights and Signs Detection)

2019 Sept - 2020 Sept

I was a member in the AuToronto perception team. I participated in the design of a traffic lights and signs detection system for a level 4 autonomous vehicle to compete in the GM/SAE Autodrive challenge. I was responsible for training and benchmarking multiple deep learning architectures for detecting and classifying different states of traffic lights and a wide variety of traffic signs ( e.g. YOLOv3, SqueezeNet, R-CNN families, etc.). I also implemented a clustering algorithm on 3D LiDAR point cloud to perform object localization for traffic signs.



UTEK 2020 Senior Design Director

2019 Sept - 2020 Feb

UTEK is the flagship engineering competition at U of T, which consists of competition from 8 different categories. I was the Co-director for the senior design competition in 2020. My main responsibilities include designing the project, providing sample code, and devliering workshops on Arduino programming.

Relevant Projects
Real-time Face Mask Detector

To combat further spread of the COVID-19, we propose to use machine learning to implement a face mask detector that can achieve real-time inference on video streams. Project proposal can be viewed here.

AuPackto: Autonomous Hardware Packing Machine

Aupackto is designed to autonomously package four types of fasteners in AER201 design course. Our team consists of three people, where each member is responsible for one of the following three subsyetems: Circuits, Electro-mechanics, and Microcontroller. As a Microcontroller member, I was responsible for programming on the PIC and Arduino to interface with various sensors and carry out the overall software logic.

Github Link: https://github.com/sherrychen127/AER201_HardwarePackagingMachine.

View the project proposal here.
